page.title: 05Visitors to Bourton
page.content: The majority of tourists who come to Bourton-on-the-Water are of the{older {generation}who come by car or coach for a day trip. Many{retired people} visit the village in the{early or late {season}and many{school parties}come for outings in{June and July.}A large proportion of the{overseas visitors } are{American}or{French}but many nationalities are here in the most popular months of July and August. Many of the gift shops and cafes close during the winter months, reopening at Easter for the holiday season.There are several hotels and inns with accommodation, restaurants and cafes. Many local pubs have adapted to the tourist trade by building extensions and by extending their range of snacks and bar food. One pub on the Fosseway supplies 140 meals on an average day in August compared to only 40 in June.
